content.question: A <math alttext="2 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi></math> object is released from rest from a height of <math alttext="3 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> above Earthâ€™s surface. How much kinetic energy does the object have when it reaches a height of <math alttext="1 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="20 joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>20</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math>
<math alttext="40 joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>40</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math>
<math alttext="60 joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>60</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math>
<math alttext="80 joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>80</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="40 joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>40</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
